hackathon-description-text: The State of Hawaii is calling all computer programmers, software developers, and tech-minded innovators to lend their collective creativity toward improving state government at the 2017 Hawaii Annual Code Challenge (HACC), the state’s second event of its kind.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Manager of Enterprise Application Services/Hawaiian Electric Co.
Principal Technologist / Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First place team as determined by the judges.
Second place team as determined by the judges
Third place team as determined by the judges
Open Category for high school teams

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Jefferson Hall, 1777 East-West Rd, Honolulu, HI 96848, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Includes the assessment made by the HACC Technical Review Committee; point
maximum is 25.
Includes creativity and uniqueness of the idea; point maximum for this category is 15.
Includes the extent to which the solution or application is polished and visually appealing; point maximum for this category is 15.
Includes using appropriate technologies being considered or currently in use by the state; point maximum for this category is 10.

Includes the uniqueness of the integration and the extent to which the application
impacts users or new users; point maximum for this category is 10.

Includes ability for team to collaborate with State of Hawaii Challenge Sponsor;
point maximum for this category is 10.

Includes the use of various media in the final presentation and a well-executed
and engaging delivery within prescribed time limit; point maximum for this category is 10.

All attendees will be invited to participate in an audience poll or overall rating for
each challenge presentation; point maximum for this category is 5.

hackathon-location-address: Jefferson Hall, 1777 East-West Rd, Honolulu, HI 96848, USA
hackathon-description-header: Creating solutions to help make government better.
